titleStmt.title: An elegie on the Right Worshipful Sir Edmund-Bury Godfrey, Knight, one of His Majesties justices of the peace: who was found murtherd on Thursday the 17th of this instant October, 1678. in a ditch on the south-side of Primrose-Hill near Hampstead.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Ben. Harris in Sweetings-Rents near the Royal-Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Strafford crowd up, and brave Montross make room,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
